section.title: Binding multiple ip-addresses
section.para: To bind more than one ip-address to the same interface, use ifcfg-eth0:0ifcfg(1), where the last zero can be anything else. Only two directives are required in the file.

section.title: Enabling extra ip-addresses
section.para: To activate a virtual network interface, use ifupifup(1), to deactivate it, use ifdownifdown(1).
section.screen: root@RHELv4u2:~# ifdown eth0:0 root@RHELv4u2:~# ifup eth0:0

section.title: Practice multiple IP addresses
section.para: 1. Add an extra ip address to your server. Test that it works (have your neighbour ssh to it)!
2. Use ifdown and ifup to disable and enable the second ip address.
